artist: Artist: Ōkura Kōtō; Publisher: Hasegawa Sonokichi, Japanese, c. 1877-1905
creditline: Gift from the collection of Edith and the late John Payne
description: horizontal ōban; naval battle scene; rising waves with billowing smoke plumes in center right; single figure, holding a sword in raised PR hand, stands on the balcony of a ship in center right edge of image; burning ship with beam of light extending toward top left in ULQ; small white dots of snow/ ash scattered over scene; red sun (flag) in URC
inscription: on back, in ULC, in pencil: 1428-DEW
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Illustrations of the Hostilities between Japan and Russia (Nichiro kōsen zue 日露交戰啚繪)
text: Retailed by Satō Tokujirō; sometimes erroneously numbered again as four 其四.
title: Part Five
